intro: Cissus desenfansii, commonly known as the African stonecrop, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its succulent, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically blooming in late summer. Its stems are woody and can climb using tendrils, allowing it to grow along trees or walls. Cissus desenfansii is adapted to arid conditions, making it drought-tolerant and suitable for xeriscaping in dry climates.
